title: Poster, "Independence National Historical Park", 1975
medium: Offset lithograph on heavy, coated white wove paper
inscribed:
Below title across lower edge of sheet in blue: Done on the occasion of the Bicentennial of the American Revolution by the National Park Service. U.S. Department of the Interior.
At left edge, center: For sale by the Superintendent of Documents U.S. Government Printing Office, Washington, D C 20404. Stock number 024-005-00606-1. GPO:1975-211-318/2
At lower left edge in black: Design: Chermayeff & Geismar Associates
description: A dramatic, close up photographic image of the crack in the Liberty Bell, located in Philadelphia. The two repair rivits are clearly visible as are the letters embossed on the bell that read PASS AND STOW / PHILADA / MDCCLIII. Below the rim of the bell across the bottom of the sheet in bright blue letters against black reads Independence National Historical Park.  The bell is depicted in blue and gray tones in a strong raking light

tombstone.epitaph:
Poster, "Independence National Historical Park", 1975.
1975. Offset lithograph on heavy, coated white wove paper. Gift of Ken Friedman. 1997-19-240.
